title: Max Whitlock and Downie sisters raise the bar as Britain matches best day at Gymnastics World Championships
text:
Until yesterday, Britain’s performances at the World Championships at Stuttgart had been promising rather than brilliant – but that changed in spectacular style as Max Whitlock and the two Downie sisters all took medals in their individual finals.

The combination of gold, silver and bronze matched the best day that Great Britain has recorded at this event. Back in 2010, Beth Tweddle won the uneven bars, with Louis Smith collecting silver on the pommel horse and Dan Purvis bronze on floor.

While Whitlock extended his supremacy as the finest male gymnast in British history, long-standing followers of the team will remember this as the day when Becky Downie finally earned the individual medal that her reliable excellence deserves.

At 27, the elder Downie sister is probably performing at her last World Championships, in preparation for a final tilt at the Olympics next year.

She has been afflicted by injuries through her long career, and has come within touching distance at this event many times.
